brief_summary.textblock:
Sodium tanshinone IIA sulfonate (STS) is a water-soluble derivative of tanshinone IIA isolated as the main pharmacologically active natural compound from a traditional Chinese herbal medicine,the dried root of Salvia miltiorrhiza Bunge known as Danshen. Danshen has been known for the function of improving body functions such as activating blood circulation and removing blood stasis according to the theory of traditional Chinese medicine. Danshen and its various formula products including STS have been long-time widely used in oriental countries, especially China to treat various inflammatory and cardiovascular diseases for its pharmacological actions, including vasodilatation, anticoagulation, anti-inflammation, and free radical scavenging,with negligible adverse effects observed.
The investigator's objective is to evaluate whether STS exhibits beneficial effects on pulmonary hypertension. This is a randomized, controlled, multicentre clinical trial study. 90 patients with pulmonary hypertension will be enrolled in this study.

primary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 0- and 8-week trial
primary_outcome.description: To assess if sodium Tanshinone IIA sulfonate decreases mean pulmonary arterial pressure.

secondary_outcome.measure: WHO functional class of pulmonary hypertension(PH)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 0-,2-, 4-,6- and 8-week of trial
At the end of 0-, 2-,4-,6- and 8-week trial

secondary_outcome.measure: Minnesota living with heart failure questionnaire
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 0-,2-, 4-,6- and 8-week trial
At the end of 0-, 2-, 4-, 6- and 8-week trial
secondary_outcome.description: To assess if sodium Tanshinone IIA sulfonate improves the exercise capacity of patients with pulmonary hypertension.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pulmonary vascular resistance(PVR) measured by right heart catheterization
secondary_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 0- and 8-week trial
secondary_outcome.description: PVR is used to evaluate whether STS decreases mPAP or increases pulmonary circulatory blood flow.

other_outcome.measure: The level of N terminal-proBNP(NT-proBNP),cardiac troponin I(cTnI) and uric acid(UA) in serum
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 0-,4- and 8-week trial
other_outcome.description: The three indicators are used to evaluate whether STS alleviates right heart failure.

other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 0-,4- and 8-week trial
other_outcome.description: The blood routine test,urine routine test,liver and kidney function and blood clotting function will be examined and some worsening events,such as death,PH aggravation,need to add other unscheduled target drugs,need to be hospitalized or prolonged hospitalization,lung and/or heart transplantation and/or any other severe adverse events surely or very likely due to STS,will be closely observed as the safety indications of STS.

other_outcome.measure: Other hemodynamic parameters measured by right heart catheterization
other_outcome.time_frame: At the end of 0- and 8-week trial
other_outcome.description: To evaluate whether STS has beneficial effects on hemodynamic parameters.
